Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2011 03:00PM FearlessSparkle wrote: Hi Deanna, Thanks for the info and link. I checked it out and I am near UCSF and close to Stanford. I am going to call and see what the next steps are!  Thank you soooo much. :)  Already feeling better about the situation! J
Posts.Title: Invisible Lump, apparently... FearlessSparkle KristenRank

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2011 12:33PM FearlessSparkle wrote: Oblong, hard as rock, painful and about the size of a walnut or golf ball and it is right on the outside of my right breast slightly under the arm pit and when I lay on my left side, you can see it.  I am working with surgeon, who is the one who told me that I am "one in a million." I just talked to my boss about this, since I don't know anyone who has gone through this (hence why I joined this forum) and he suggested that I call our Employee Assistance Program folks for a reference to another Doctor.  Because, I seriously don't understand how this lump doesn't show on an MRI.  I saw my heart on the MRI slides for goodness sakes!  How can my Dr say that he can't explain it? That just doesn't make sense to me!
Posts.Title: Invisible Lump, apparently... FearlessSparkle KristenRank
